node.title: Score! Carter gets his kicks for charity - 1598 of them
node.description: All Black and Crusaders legend Dan Carter has just completed a 24-hour kickathon in an effort to raise funds for children across New Zealand and the Pacific.

node.title: 'Made a bad situation worse': Russia tariffs set to hit fertiliser prices
node.description: Farmers will face increased costs for fertiliser as global demand is affected by import bans and tariff hikes imposed on Russia.

node.title: Thousands of greater Sydney residents affected by flood evacuations
node.description: More than 2000 people have been affected by evacuation orders across Sydney, and one man has been found drowned in his car.

node.title: Week in Politics: Settings, sanctions and Ashley Bloomfield
node.description: Analysis - The PM decides the country will stay in red for a while longer, the government ramps up sanctions against Russia but the opposition wants more, and Ashley Bloomfield resigns.

node.title: High Court rules vaccine mandates justified for doctors, teachers
node.description: A legal challenge questioning the lawfulness of the government's Covid-19 vaccination mandate for educators and health workers has failed in the High Court.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 9906 new cases and 10 further deaths, including one under 19
node.description: Ten new deaths have been reported today - including someone aged between 10-19 - while the daily number of new community cases in New Zealand has dropped back below the 10,000 mark.

node.title: 'At the moment, we're scared': KiwiRail yard gets thumbs-up but residents worried
node.description: A huge new rail yard proposed for the outskirts of Palmerston North is a step closer to reality. Affected residents are unhappy, but KiwiRail says the yards are much needed.

node.title: New tool developed for less invasive prostate cancer testing
node.description: The much maligned process for prostate cancer testing may soon be ditched - thanks to the invention of a tiny tool that's showing promising results. Audio

node.title: F1 returns to Melbourne
node.description: Two years after the Australian Grand Prix was scrapped, Formula One returns Down Under to an upgraded Albert Park in Melbourne.

node.title: Covid-19: New reports highlight virus' impact on Māori and Pacific communities
node.description: Two reports collating Covid-19 data on Māori and Pacific peoples have revealed an uptick in deaths in both groups in the week ended 3 April.

node.title: Increasing freight movement forecasts economic growth
node.description: Rising domestic freight movements suggests the economy managed to grow during the first three months of the year, despite the effects of the Omicron outbreak.

node.title: New Zealand confirms oil reserve release
node.description: New Zealand will release about another 483,000 barrels from its emergency oil stocks as part of a global effort to ease fuel prices.

node.title: Pink Floyd joins forces with wounded Ukrainian singer in new song
node.description: British rock band Pink Floyd will release a new song to raise money for humanitarian relief in Ukraine, featuring the vocals of a Ukrainian singer who quit an international tour to fight for his…

node.title: Nobel Peace Prize-winning Russian anti-war journalist attacked with paint
node.description: Russia's Nobel Peace Prize-winning journalist Dmitry Muratov says he has been attacked with red paint laced with the solvent acetone aboard a train.

node.title: Attempted murder charge laid after injured victim found in ditch
node.description: Gisborne Police have charged a man with attempted murder after another man was found in a ditch with life-threatening injuries.

node.title: Vanuatu announces border reopening
node.description: Citing high vaccination rates, Vanuatu is reopening to the world starting in May.

node.title: Confiscation debate over sliver of land: 'This is our opportunity to stand up for our people'
node.description: A sliver of land just a metre wide has sparked a call for recognition of historic land confiscation when council land is sold in New Plymouth.

node.title: Establishment of Māori Health Authority stirs controversy ahead of election year
node.description: Two opposition leaders say they will scrap the new Māori Health Authority if they are elected next year but their stance is receiving pushback from a number of NGOs.

node.title: 'What did they liberate us from?': Russian troops' brutality detailed
node.description: Rapes, shootings and an execution in a rural village are further evidence of Russian war crimes, the ABC is reporting.

node.title: Ketanji Brown Jackson: US Senate votes to confirm judge to top court
node.description: The US Supreme Court is to include a black female justice for the first time in its 233-year history after the Senate confirmed Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson to the nine-member bench.

node.title: Queenstown hotel faces butler bother ahead of tourist arrivals
node.description: Queenstown's latest luxury hotel is facing an unusual staffing quandary as it prepares to welcome Australian tourists - it can't find any trained butlers. Audio

node.title: Wildfire near Invercargill now mostly contained
node.description: A large fire that has been burning through conservation wetlands south of Invercargill is mostly contained.

node.title: Police seek vital information in Nelson death investigation
node.description: Police are appealing for anyone with information about the death of Simon Bevers at a rural property in Hope, near Nelson, to disclose it to police.

node.title: Russia suspended from UN Human Rights Council over Ukraine
node.description: The UN resolution expressed "grave concern at the ongoing human rights and humanitarian crisis in Ukraine," particularly at reports of rights abuses by Russia.

node.title: Fox News correspondent Benjamin Hall shares first update since Ukraine attack
node.description: Fox News cameraman Pierre Zakrzewski and fixer Oleksandra "Sasha" Kuvshynova were killed in the same attack.

node.title: My Food Bag profits rise as people stay home due to Covid-19
node.description: The meal-kit delivery business is reporting strong full year preliminary results, with ample demand as people stayed home.

node.title: Black Sticks on hunt for new coach
node.description: The Black Sticks women's hockey team are on the look-out for a new coach.

node.title: Men accused of impersonating federal agents being investigated for possible ties to Iranian intelligence
node.description: The two men will remain in jail overnight pending a detention hearing Friday.

node.title: Fox reporter Benjamin Hall shares first update since Ukraine attack
node.description: Fox News cameraman Pierre Zakrzewski and fixer Oleksandra "Sasha" Kuvshynova were killed in the same attack.

node.title: Tiger Woods' Masters hype can't overshadow his dubious past
node.description: Opinion - Tiger Woods' presence at the US Masters may be dominating the headlines but his dubious actions off the course mustn't be ignored, Hamish Bidwell writes.
